entry.title: Chris Cuomo jokes with his governor brother: You're single and ready to mingle

media:group.media:title: Chris Cuomo jokes with his governor brother: You're single and ready to mingle
media:group.media:description:
CNN's Chris Cuomo and brother Gov. Andrew Cuomo (D-NY) discuss federal funding and timetables of reopening states during the coronavirus pandemic. Chris also asks his brother about his recent appearance on "The Ellen Degeneres Show."
#CNN #News

entry.title: Study finds black communities account for disproportionate number of Covid-19 deaths in US

media:group.media:title: Study finds black communities account for disproportionate number of Covid-19 deaths in US
media:group.media:description:
There's new evidence more African Americans may be dying from coronavirus in the United States than whites or other ethnic groups, according to a new study. Black Americans represent 13.4% of the population, according to the US Census Bureau, but counties with higher black populations account for more than half of all Covid-19 cases and almost 60% of deaths, the study found.
#CNN #News

entry.title: Obama administration acting CDC director says 'we can't accept that as a society'

media:group.media:title: Obama administration acting CDC director says 'we can't accept that as a society'
media:group.media:description:
Former CDC director Dr. Richard Besser and CNN's Anderson Cooper discuss the economic effect that the coronavirus is having on some minority communities in the US.
#CNN #News

entry.title: Bill de Blasio: Trump is politicizing a pandemic

media:group.media:title: Bill de Blasio: Trump is politicizing a pandemic
media:group.media:description:
New York mayor Bill de Blasio tells CNN's John Berman that President Trump is politicizing the coronavirus pandemic by discussing 'red states' and 'blue states' when it comes to funding and stimulus money to help fight Covid-19.
#CNN #News

entry.title: Wife of slain security guard: Shooters can't take away his legacy

media:group.media:title: Wife of slain security guard: Shooters can't take away his legacy
media:group.media:description: Calvin Munerlyn was a 43-year-old security guard who officials say was shot dead after he told a customer at a Michigan Family Dollar to wear a state-mandated face mask. CNN's Don Lemon spoke with his wife Latryna Munerlyn about the kind-hearted man and devoted father of eight he was. #CNN #News

entry.title: Trump doesn't wear mask to facility manufacturing masks

media:group.media:title: Trump doesn't wear mask to facility manufacturing masks
media:group.media:description: President Trump was seen not wearing a face mask during his visit to the Honeywell factory in Arizona, which manufactures N95 masks. #CNN #News

entry.title: See why this watch sold for over $31 million

media:group.media:title: See why this watch sold for over $31 million
media:group.media:description: A Patek Philippe wristwatch sold for a record $31M at a charity auction hosted by Christie's in Switzerland. #CNN #News

entry.title: Doctor treating Covid-19 patients denied green card: Like a slap in the face

media:group.media:title: Doctor treating Covid-19 patients denied green card: Like a slap in the face
media:group.media:description: Dr. Julia Iafrate is a sponsored immigrant volunteering to help save the lives of coronavirus patients in the ICU, and says she was denied a green card despite her extensive credentials. CNN's Chris Cuomo speaks with her about her experience. #CNN #News

entry.title: Cher won Oscar night in 1986 and wasn't even nominated

media:group.media:title: Cher won Oscar night in 1986 and wasn't even nominated
media:group.media:description:
Cher enlisted the help of her long-time fashion collaborator Bob Mackie to challenge the status quo at the 1986 Oscars and created an iconic moment in fashion.
#Cher #CNN #News

entry.title: Why it can be so hard to care about the climate crisis

media:group.media:title: Why it can be so hard to care about the climate crisis
media:group.media:description:
The human brain just isn't wired to grasp the looming threats of the climate crisis, CNN's Dr. Sanjay Gupta explains. But there is hope if we change how we look at the problem.
#DrGupta #CNN #News

entry.title: Trump explains why he plans to wind down the coronavirus task force

media:group.media:title: Trump explains why he plans to wind down the coronavirus task force
media:group.media:description: CNN's Anderson Cooper reports that President Donald Trump plans to wind down the coronavirus task force near the end of May. #CNN #News

entry.title: Top US general: 'Weight of evidence' says Covid-19 not man-made

media:group.media:title: Top US general: 'Weight of evidence' says Covid-19 not man-made
media:group.media:description:
The Pentagon's top general, Joint Chiefs chairman Gen. Mark Milley, says that the "weight of evidence" indicates that the Covid-19 coronavirus points to natural origins-- not a Chinese lab.
#Coronavirus #CNN #News

entry.title: Trump rants against George Conway after new ad airs

media:group.media:title: Trump rants against George Conway after new ad airs
media:group.media:description:
The Lincoln Project, a group created by some prominent "Never Trump" Republicans, including the spouse of a Trump adviser, released an ad that the President went after in a late-night tweet.
#Trump #CNN #News

entry.title: Three doctors mysteriously fall out of Russian hospital windows

media:group.media:title: Three doctors mysteriously fall out of Russian hospital windows
media:group.media:description: Three frontline health care workers have mysteriously fallen out of hospital windows in Russia over the past two weeks, heightening public attention to the working conditions for doctors and medical professionals amid the coronavirus pandemic. #CNN #News

entry.title: Ousted vaccine director says pandemic warnings were ignored

media:group.media:title: Ousted vaccine director says pandemic warnings were ignored
media:group.media:description:
Dr. Rick Bright, the ousted director of the office involved in developing a coronavirus vaccine, formally filed an extensive whistleblower complaint Tuesday alleging his early warnings about the coronavirus were ignored and that his caution at a treatment favored by President Donald Trump led to his removal.
Bright said in the complaint he raised urgent concerns about shortages of critical supplies, including masks, to his superiors in the Trump administration but was met with skepticism and surprise. While Bright said some officials shared his concerns -- including top White House trade adviser Peter Navarro -- he describes an overall lack of action at the top of the administration even as the virus was spreading outside of China. Bright had led the Biomedical Advanced Research and Development Authority since 2016 when he was reassigned last month to a narrower position at the National Institutes of Health.
#Coronavirus #CNN #News
